poem:
**Mourning in Moscow**

In the shadowed quiet of a November dawn,  
four names now echo through the corridors  
of a small town's memory—Kaylee, Ethan,  
Xana, Madison—spoken softer than whispers  
on fallen leaves, each syllable a silent vigil  
to a mystery wreathed in sorrow and unknowing,  
leaving only the cold breath of questions behind.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Idaho Four review – a disturbing, necessary portrait of a killer and his victims In the early hours of 13 November 2022 in an off-campus apartment in Moscow, Idaho, a masked assailant murdered four students. The dead, who would come to be known as the Idaho Four, were Kaylee Goncalves, Ethan Chapin, Xana Kernodle and Madison Mogen. Each was stabbed multiple times. The killer left a gruesome scene and the motive was not readily". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
